intro: Crawfurdia pricei, commonly known as the African violets, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with five petals and a distinctive white or pink center. Crawfurdia pricei is valued for its ornamental qualities and is commonly cultivated as a houseplant.
